item.title: Major pothole at end of speed bump, 26th January
item.description:
This major pothole at the end of the speed bump has significantly worsened over the past two years, with no noticeable improvement. While there are several potholes along the street, this one in particular has caused damage to my vehicle, and other residents have also reported similar issues. When the pothole fills with rainwater, it is difficult for road users to see and avoid, creating a heightened risk—especially for cyclists and motorcyclists. I would also like to highlight that this road is a key route connecting traffic to Tower Bridge Road and is frequently used by police and diplomatic escorts. I would appreciate it if this issue could be addressed as a matter of urgency to ensure the safety and wellbeing of all road users.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot holes / uneven road surface, 26th January
item.description:
In the road directly outside the entrance to Dulverton School there are pot holes and an uneven road surface. As soon as a larger vehicle drives over the surface at 30mph it literally shakes our whole house & makes so much noise from the vibrations created.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Dulverton Road, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illigal dumping, 26th January
item.description:
There is an ongoing and serious illegal dumping problem in the neighbourhood. Individuals regularly arrive at night to dump unwanted furniture and general waste. This issue has persisted for over a year, yet no effective action has been taken. It is unacceptable that such a long-standing problem has not been addressed by the relevant authorities. Immediate action is required. Please work with Clarion Housing Association to put an effective and permanent solution in place without further delay.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35-85, Wadhurst Close, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Significant mud in road, 26th January
item.description:
